Description: Mould-made lamp with handle and rosette pattern. Circular based pink-grey pottery oil lamp with small rims around base. Protruding nozzle for pouring. Closed handle. Almost circular shaped hole in centre for oil. Three concentric circles and floral pattern around the central hole. Pale red-brown Nile silt fabric with red core with common fine quartz, mica, organic vesicles and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by City Art Gallery and Museum, Bristol. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Parallels fromn 'Damenhur' and Marion Tomb K, Cyprus (Bailey 1988, British Museum Lamps III, Q2071 and Q2069).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KE.29) (Phase 1)
